channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Will Trump Sell His Big Policy Bill to the American Public?
item.description: President Trump has spent days cajoling Republicans to support his spending bill. He will also have to sell it to a skeptical public as Democrats focu...

item.title: Iran’s Quiet Campaign of Domestic Terror
item.description: The regime is sending a chilling message: Dissent equals death.

item.title: Mamdani Identified as Asian and African American on College Application
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, the Democrat running for mayor of New York City, was born in Uganda. He doesn’t consider himself Black but said the application didn’t...

item.title: Michael Madsen, Actor Known for ‘Reservoir Dogs’ and ‘Kill Bill,’ Dies at 67
item.description: He had the air of a timeless Hollywood heavy in movies like “Reservoir Dogs” and “Kill Bill.” “I’m a bit of a throwback to the days of black-and-white...

item.title: Trump Says Call with Putin Yields No Progress on Ukraine Cease-Fire
item.description: The apparent impasse came during a roughly hourlong conversation between the leaders on Thursday morning.

item.title: Why China Isn’t Lecturing Trump About His Costly Bill
item.description: Beijing has a history of warning Washington about the safety of its Treasury holdings. This time it may have reasons to stay silent, at least publicly...

item.title: Mexico Confirms Arrest Warrant for Boxer Julio César Chávez Jr.
item.description: The well-known Mexican boxer was detained by U.S. immigration agents in California on Wednesday, days after fighting a high-profile contest against th...

item.title: From Cooking on TV to Feeding the Front Line in Ukraine
item.description: This chef appeared on TV before joining the army when Russia invaded in 2022. Now he makes his borscht for troops instead of cooking show judges.

item.title: Can Indonesia Afford Prabowo’s Free School Lunch Program?
item.description: Indonesia’s president promised free meals for every student in the country. But unemployment is rising, and some analysts say he’s making matters wors...

item.title: Vatican Publishes a New Mass on Caring for the Environment
item.description: The Mass, along with other steps, show Pope Leo XIV and the Roman Catholic Church building on the environmental commitment of his predecessor, Francis...

item.title: The next phase of Starbucks’ turnaround plan is offering executives up to $6 million in stock grants, as baristas scrap to get annual raises above 2%
item.description: Baristas reportedly received 2% to 3% pay increases at the end of 2024 following a tough financial year. New CEO Brian Niccol received nearly $100 mil...

item.title: Trump’s Big Beautiful Bill will accelerate an American energy crisis—and it could cost the U.S. the AI race
item.description: The megabill just passed by Congress handicaps clean energy when the U.S. needs more power more quickly.

item.title: Stocks hit another record as House sends Trump $4.5 trillion bill to kick off July 4 weekend
item.description: The S&P 500 hit another record after data showed strong hiring.

item.title: RFK Jr. wants more people wearing health wearables in the name of ‘MAHA’
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is making health wearables a major part of his preventive health agenda.

item.title: White knuckles and ‘massive unknowns’ ahead of Trump’s July 9th tariff deadline
item.description: Trump’s next moves could impact how countries go about the next round of trade talks
